alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 10:53PM MST until January 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 6 inches by Saturday morning. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 17 to 25 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Saturday night through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers could become disoriented and lost. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
